channel.title: Pages on Genomics X AI
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Genomics X AI

item.title: Editorial Board
item.description:
Editorial Team

The Genomics × AI blog is managed by a team of editors who review submissions and ensure quality standards.

Editors

Editors review submissions via GitHub Pull Requests and provide feedback to authors. They ensure that:

  • Content meets quality and relevance standards
  • Scientific accuracy is maintained
  • Submission guidelines are followed
  • Community standards are upheld

Current Editors

  • Alan Murphy (@Al-Murphy)
  • Da-Wei Lin (@dwgoblue)
  • Alejandra Durán (@aduranu)

List synced from the @genomicsxai/editors GitHub team.

Becoming an Editor

If you’re interested in joining the editorial board, please contact us through GitHub Discussions.

item.title: Forum
item.description:
Community Discussion

Join the conversation on GitHub Discussions:

  • General Discussion - General topics and announcements
  • Methods - Discussion about methods and techniques
  • Post Discussions - Discussions about published posts
  • Calls for Posts - Open calls and opportunities

Note: Each blog post also has a dedicated discussion thread. Look for the “Discuss this post” link on individual posts.

item.title: Policies
item.description:
Editorial and Community Policies

The Genomics × AI blog follows transparent, Git-native policies for submissions, review, and discussion.

Submission and Review

  • All posts are submitted via Pull Request and require at least one editor approval before merge.
  • Authors are expected to complete lab-internal review before submitting.
  • Editors review for suitability, scientific accuracy, and adherence to Submission Guidelines.

Access and Permissions

  • Authors: Submit and revise posts via PRs.
  • Editors: Review, request changes, and merge to main. Implemented via GitHub branch protection and the @genomicsxai/editors team (CODEOWNERS).
  • Readers: View content and participate in GitHub Discussions.

Code of Conduct and Reuse

  • Content is published under the site’s default license (see footer or per-post notices).
  • By submitting, you confirm you have the rights to publish the content and that it meets our Submission Guidelines.

Changes to These Policies

Policy updates are proposed and discussed via the repository (e.g. issues or discussions) and reflected in this page after consensus.

For questions, use GitHub Discussions or open an issue.

item.title: Submission Guidelines
item.description:
How to Submit a Blog Post

Overview

The Genomics × AI blog uses a Git-native, PR-based submission workflow. All submissions go through peer review before the post goes live.

Submission Process

  1. Write Your Post

    • Use the blog post template (copy the frontmatter and adapt)
    • Conduct internal lab review first
    • Ensure all required frontmatter fields are complete

  2. Create a Pull Request

    • Fork the repository
    • Add your post to content/blogs/YYYY-NNN/index.md
    • Create a PR with the submission template filled out

  3. Editor Review

    • Editors will review your submission
    • They may request changes via PR comments
    • Address feedback and update your PR

  4. Going live

    • Once approved, editors will merge your PR
    • The post will be automatically deployed via GitHub Actions
    • Your post will appear on the blog

Writing Note

There is no strict criteria on the style that your blog post should follow but aim to make it clear and engaging!
